parse.title: List of Canadian provincial and territorial symbols

text.*:
This is a list of the symbols of the provinces and territories of Canada. Each province and territory has a unique set of official symbols.

Contents

  • 1 Provinces and territories
  • 2 See also
  • 3 Notes
  • 4 References

Provinces and territories[edit]

Name Flag Coat of arms Bird Animal (Mammal) Fish Flower Tree Mineral Motto Other
Alberta[1] Great horned owl Bighorn sheep Bull trout Wild rose Lodgepole pine Petrified wood Fortis et liber
(strong and free) 		Provincial grass: rough fescue,
song: "Alberta",
gemstone: ammolite
British Columbia[2] Steller's jay Spirit bear Pacific salmon Pacific dogwood Western redcedar Jade Splendor sine occasu
(splendour without diminishment) 		-
Manitoba[3] Great grey owl Plains bison Walleye Prairie crocus White spruce Gloriosus et liber
(glorious and free) 		Provincial grass: big bluestem,
fossil: Tylosaurus pembinensis (mosasaur),
soil: Newdale soil (Orthic Black Chernozem)
New Brunswick[4] Black-capped chickadee - - Purple violet Balsam fir - Spem reduxit
(hope was restored) 		Provincial soil: Holmesville
Newfoundland and Labrador[5] Atlantic puffin (provincial bird)
Willow ptarmigan
Rock ptarmigan (game bird) 		Woodland caribou
Newfoundland pony
(heritage animal) 		- Purple pitcher plant Black spruce Labradorite Quaerite primum regnum dei
(seek ye first the kingdom of God) 		Anthem: "Ode to Newfoundland",
Newfoundland Tricolour,
Labrador flag
Northwest Territories[6] Gyrfalcon - Arctic grayling Mountain avens Tamarack larch Gold - Territorial gemstone: diamond
Nova Scotia[7] Osprey Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever
Sable Island horse 		Brook trout Mayflower Red spruce Stilbite Munit haec et altera vincit
(one defends and the other conquers) 		Sailing ambassador: Bluenose II,
Nova Scotia tartan;
berry: wild blueberry;
fossil: Hylonomus lyelli;
gemstone: agate
Nunavut[8] [nb 1] Rock ptarmigan Canadian Inuit Dog - Purple saxifrage - - Nunavut Sanginivut
(Our land, our strength) 		-
Ontario[9] Common loon - - White trillium Eastern white pine Amethyst Ut incepit fidelis sic permanet
(loyal she began thus she remains) 		-
Prince Edward Island[10] [nb 1] Blue jay - - Lady's slipper Red oak - Parva sub ingenti
(the small under the protection of the great) 		Provincial soil: Charlottetown;
anthem: "The Island Hymn"
Quebec[11] Snowy owl - - Blue flag iris Yellow birch - Je me souviens
(I remember) 		Provincial symbol: fleur-de-lis
Saskatchewan[12] [nb 1] Sharp-tailed grouse White-tailed deer Walleye Western red lily White birch Potash Multis e gentibus vires
(from many peoples, strength) 		Provincial grass: needle-and-thread grass,
fruit emblem: Saskatoon berry
Yukon[13] Common raven - - Fireweed Subalpine fir Lazulite - -

See also[edit]

  • Canada portal
  • National symbols of Canada
  • Regional tartans of Canada

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ a b c This is a partial representation of the coat of arms.

References[edit]

  1. ^ "Emblems of Alberta". Alberta Culture and Tourism. 2017-06-14. Archived from the original on 2017-04-08. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  2. ^ Government of British Columbia. "Symbols of British Columbia". Archived from the original on 2017-07-07. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  3. ^ Government of Manitoba. "Official Emblems of Manitoba" (PDF). Archived (PDF) from the original on 2017-07-10. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  4. ^ Government of New Brunswick. "Symbols of New Brunswick". Archived from the original on 2017-07-09. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  5. ^ Government of Newfoundland and Labrador. "Symbols of Newfoundland and Labrador". Archived from the original on 2016-12-24. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  6. ^ Government of the Northwest Territories. "Symbols of the Northwest Territories". Archived from the original on 2017-07-04. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  7. ^ Government of Nova Scotia. "Symbols of Nova Scotia". Archived from the original on 2017-07-01. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  8. ^ Government of Nunavut. "Official Symbols Gallery". Archived from the original on 2017-02-22. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  9. ^ Legislative Assembly of Ontario. "Emblems and Symbols". Archived from the original on 2016-12-20. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  10. ^ Government of Prince Edward Island. "Symbols of Prince Edward Island". Archived from the original on 2016-08-30. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  11. ^ Government of Quebec. "National Flag and Emblems". Archived from the original on 2016-08-20. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  12. ^ Government of Saskatchewan. "Emblems of Saskatchewan". Archived from the original on 2017-06-10. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  13. ^ Government of Yukon. "Emblems and Symbols of Yukon". Archived from the original on 2017-06-30. Retrieved 2017-07-10. 
  • Government of Canada (2016-01-12). "Provincial and territorial symbols". Retrieved 2017-07-10.
